item.title: Traci add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Saying 'I notice you're a nerd' is like saying, 'Hey, I notice that you'd rather be intelligent than be stupid, that you'd rather be thoughtful than be vapid, that you believe that there are things that matter more than the arrest record of Lindsay Lohan. Why is that?' In fact, it seems to me that most contemporary insults are pretty lame. Even 'lame' is kind of lame. Saying 'You're lame' is like saying 'You walk with a limp.' Yeah, whatever, so does 50 Cent, and he's done all right for himself." -- John Green

item.title: Traci add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Imagining the future is a kind of nostalgia. (...) You spend your whole life stuck in the labyrinth, thinking about how you'll escape it one day, and how awesome it will be, and imagining that future keeps you going, but you never do it. You just use the future to escape the present." -- John Green

item.title: Traci add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Destroying things is much easier than making them." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Traci add a quote by Melissa Anelli
item.description:
"...she wasn't reading Deathly Hallows at all. Her book wasn't orange but rose and water and sand, and featured a kid on a broomstick and white unicorn. Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone. She didn't notice me staring at her.
'Oh, I envy you,' I thought, but was smiling for her. She had just begun." -- Melissa Anelli

item.title: Traci add a quote by Melissa Anelli
item.description: "Harry Potter has actually been a very intimate phenomenon, the story of small groups of people acting in ways they shouldn't, doing things they usually wouldn't, and making the kind of history that, without Harry, they pretty much couldn't." -- Melissa Anelli

item.title: Traci add a quote by John Green
item.description: "It's more impressive," I said out loud. "From a distance, I mean. You can't see the wear on things, you know? You can't see the rust or the weeds or the paint cracking. You see the place as someone once imagined it." -- John Green

item.title: Traci add a quote by Jennifer Donnelly
item.description: "Life’s all about the revolution, isn’t it? The one inside, I mean. You can’t change history. You can’t change the world. All you can ever change is yourself." -- Jennifer Donnelly

item.title: Traci add a quote by Jennifer Donnelly
item.description: "History is a Rorschach test, people. What you see when you look at it tells you as much about yourself as it does about the past." -- Jennifer Donnelly

item.title: Traci add a quote by Jennifer Donnelly
item.description: "One expects decent people to stand up for the good of all. Decent people shut their doors and hide behind them as decent people do. Massacres could never happen if it weren't for decent people." -- Jennifer Donnelly

item.title: Traci add a quote by Maureen Johnson
item.description: "Claim whatever you want. Say you only want a happy family or a successful career or a big house. I say: no, that's not what you want. You'll settle for those things, but you really want a monkey that does your evil bidding. Pullman is a genius just for this." -- Maureen Johnson

item.title: Traci add a quote by Maureen Johnson
item.description: "What the hell is wrong with you?" he asked. It was a good question." -- Maureen Johnson

item.title: Traci add a quote by Maureen Johnson
item.description: "because talent alone doesn't make an artist" -- Maureen Johnson

item.title: Traci add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "These are hard times. The world hurts. We live in fear and forget to walk with hope. But hope has not forgotten you. So ask it to dinner. It's probably hungry and would appreciate the invitation." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Traci add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "Dude, this is a stoner conversation and we're not even high" -- Libba Bray

item.title: Traci add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "In our travels, we have come across many equations--math for understanding the universe, for making music, for mapping stars, and also for tipping, which is important. Here is our favorite equation: Us plus Them equals All of Us. It is very simple math. Try it sometime. You probably won’t even need a pencil." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Traci add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "You've influenced the world not because you wanted to hug it and cuddle it and call it sweet thing, but because one day you wanted to beat the crap out of somebody but you didn't. You made a painting instead." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Traci add a quote by Veronica Roth
item.description: "We believe in ordinary acts of bravery, in the courage that drives one person to stand up for another." -- Veronica Roth

item.title: Traci add a quote by John Green
item.description: "You have a choice in this world, I believe, about how to tell sad stories, and we made the funny choice." -- John Green

item.title: Traci add a quote by John Green
item.description: "But it is the nature of stars to cross, and never was Shakespeare more wrong than when he has Cassius note, ‘The fault, dear Brutus, is not in our stars / But in ourselves." -- John Green

item.title: Traci add a quote by John Green
item.description: "there is no shortage of fault to be found amid our stars" -- John Green
